Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Revolver Noir
boardgame.description:
It was supposed to be an easy job, investigating this abandoned mansion. Suddenly a shot rings out in the darkness, the bullet shattering the plaster behind you. Turns out someone is here as well, and only one of you is leaving alive.

Revolver Noir is game for two players that puts you in the shoes of a private eye stuck in a dark mansion with an unknown hostile. Using a combination of detective work and calculated shots in the dark, your goal is to track down your enemy and put an end to them – before they do the same to you.


Finalist (top 3) of Button Shy's 18 Card Challenge: Design a game that doesn't use a table or surface.


Setup

Give one player all the John Doe cards, and the other all the Jane Doe cards.
Each player chooses one room in which to start, then places the rest of their cards behind it in their hand. The visible card is your current location.


The turn alternates between players. On your turn, you have Action Points, which you can spend to perform actions like moving, shooting, listening, setting traps, and use the room effect.

Use Room Effect
Most rooms in Revolver Noir have a unique effect, which can be used only while you are in that room. To trigger this effect, reveal your location, then follow the instructions on your room card.

Winning the Game
The objective is simple. To win, you’ll have to hit your opponent twice.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Contests: Button Shy Game Design Contests and Challenges

boardgame.name: The Automated Infinigrad Suburb Generator
boardgame.description:
From website:

Use the following tables and buttons to generate a suburb in a fantasy megacity.

boardgame.name: Magical Tarurūto-kun: Fantastic World!!
boardgame.description:
Source: The Game Website.

Magical * Taruruuto-kun: Fantastic World!! is an Action game, developed by TOSE and published by Bandai, which was released in Japan in 1991.

boardgame.name: Ordure Fantasy
boardgame.description:
From website:

Ordure Fantasy is a super simple, single d6 based OSR inspired roleplaying game.

Included in the book:

Core and combat rules described on a single page.
Generators, reaction tables and examples for super simple 1 stat enemies.
Four player character classes with abilities encouraging inventive, engaging and interesting interactions with the game world, in and out of combat.
Seven pages of d6 based tables for the referee, including world creation, quest, NPC, town, dungeon, wilderness, and random encounter generation.

boardgame.name: Infinigrad Freelancer.
boardgame.description:
From website:

The Infinigrad Freelancers are adventurers exploring the great unmapped alleyway wilds of the city for fun and profit, willing to use their specific skill sets in the machinations of any group that will pay them the silver.

Explore the Endless City with Ordure Fantasy 1d6 RPG , a super simple, single d6 based OSR inspired roleplaying game.

Included in the book:

Core and combat rules described on a single page.
Rules and reaction tables for super simple 1 stat enemies.
6 mutations and 36 skills for Infinigrad Freelancers.
Rules and examples for Freelancer augmentation system.
Tables for the referee, including quick merchant pricing table, exposition generator, suburb political situation generator and Infinigrad job generator.
Heat Test rules for resolving consequences of Freelancer jobs.


Infinigrad Freelancer is designed as a diving board to explore the billions of suburbs and city details that can be generated using the Automated Infinigrad Suburb Generator.

boardgame.name: Death Valley
Valle de la Muerte
boardgame.description:
Sunlight glaring through the windshield. Your favorite songs blasting through the speakers. Candy bar wrappers piled next to a warm drink in the cheap plastic cupholder. Your companion riding in the passenger seat, snapping pictures of landmarks as you settle into the hypnotic rhythm of the road. But be careful as this fun road trip could get dangerous as you drive through Death Valley.

Death Valley is a pocket-sized, push-your-luck, tableau-building game for 1-2 players, with each traveler striving to assemble the best mix of cards in their journey and scrapbook in order to win the game.

Each turn, players choose whether to assign a card to their journey, or move cards from their journey to their scrapbook. Cards feature stars (points), special abilities (which affect the value and position of cards), and some interesting facts about Death Valley. Each card also lists a hazard: heat, terrain, flood or animals. Having three of the same hazard visible in their tableau causes the player to bust and lose all the progress in their journey.

At the end of the game, players sum the stars in their journey and any additional points from card abilities to determine who wins.

Death Valley was a top-three finalist in Button Shy's 18-Card Challenge: Design a game about a real life location.

boardgame.name: Billionaires Money
boardgame.description:
A simple and fun game you play with the objective to become the first one to accumulate one billions dollars and hence become a Billionaire. Collect money by landing on the right slots while avoiding pitfalls that will rob you of your money.

The pitfalls include locations such as “Donation,” “Robbery”, "You Didn't Build That", "Wealth Redistribution", and "Tax The Rich".

Billionaires Money is for 2-10 players ages 14 and up.

It comes with 6 denominations of money up to $1 billion.

The Monopoly-esque board game comes with features such as “Property,” cards that award players with items like a yacht, island, helicopter, luxury car, or fine art, and “Business,” cards that equip players with revenue-generating operations such as a global coffee chain, burger franchise, or beauty supplies store.

boardgame.name: Hórreos
boardgame.description:
It is the 18th century in Galicia, Spain. Elaborate raised granaries known as hórreos are garnering acclaim for their agricultural importance and aesthetic beauty. Now the neighboring towns of Carnota and Lira are engaged in a competition to create the best hórreo. Can you build the longest, most ornate structure that keeps the mice out?

A game of building and rivalries. In the game you represent the neighboring villages of Lira and Carnota facing against each other to build the best hórreo.

You will use simultaneous selection of actions to try to get the best plans to build your hórreo, stealing them from your opponent, building them or sabotaging your enemy's actions, always keeping in mind that some actions go first than others and your plans might end up being disrupted.

Get the most points by by cleverly building your hórreo from different parts, trying to have the most ornate one, the longest and to prevent mice.


Winner of Button Shy's 18 Card Challenge: Design a game about a real life location.

Released in the January 2021 Board Game of the Month Club $20+ package.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Contests: Button Shy Game Design Contests and Challenges

boardgame.name: Two Point Hospital: Culture Shock
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Culture is drying up - and you have to cure it!

3 new locations
3 new cure machines
12 new visual illnesses and 36 new illnesses in total
New gameplay
New music, DJ and tannoy lines

boardgame.name: Descent: Légende des Ténèbres
Descent: Legenden der Finsternis
Descent: Legends of the Dark
Descent: Legendy Mroku
Descent: Leggende delle Tenebre
Descent: Lendas da Escuridão
Descent: Leyendas de las Tinieblas
深入绝地：黑暗传奇
디센트: 암흑의 전설
boardgame.description:
Terrinoth is in peril. The demon-tainted Uthuk Y'llan barbarians stalk the realm and the undead servants of Waiqar the Undying venture beyond their borders for the first time in memory. The leaders of Terrinoth are divided and fractious, unable to unite against these common threats. And in the northern barony of Forthyn, the stage is set for the next great confrontation between Terrinoth and the forces of darkness...

For years, your journeys have taken you across the fantasy realm of Terrinoth, venturing into dark forests, shadowy cities, ancient crypts, and misty swamps — but your true legend is about to begin.

Forge your own legend together with friends as you adventure across the vibrant fantasy realm of Terrinoth in the co-operative dungeon-crawling board game Descent: Legends of the Dark. Powered by an integrated free companion app, Descent: Legends of the Dark puts you in the role of a budding hero with their own playstyle and abilities. Together with your unlikely companions, you'll begin an unexpected adventure — an adventure told across the sixteen quests of the "Blood and Flame" campaign. Throughout your campaign, you'll face undead lurking in the mists, demonic barbarians stalking the wilds, and even more terrifying threats. With 46 pieces of 3D terrain and forty hero and monster miniatures to draw you into the game, your greatest adventure is yet before you! Your objectives will change from quest to quest as you follow the overarching story of the campaign.

Core gameplay mechanisms such as combat, fatigue, skills, items, and more have received completely new interpretations with Legends of the Dark, while a new approach to scenario layout and 3D terrain creates striking multi-level scenarios.

Gameplay is fast and intuitive. You take three actions each turn: one maneuver action and two additional actions of your choice. Maneuvering gives you movement points, as shown in the upper right corner of the character sheet, and since you always have a maneuver action, you can reposition to put yourself in a more advantageous position for attack. Other than maneuvering, you can use an action to attack an enemy, rolling your attack dice and drawing upon your hero's abilities and weapons to deal maximum damage or inflict harmful conditions on your foes, or you may use the explore action to interact with a piece of 3D terrain or a token by using the app. You can also use your action to perform one of the most crucial actions in Legends of the Dark: the ready action, which lets you flip your hero sheet or one of your cards to its opposite side, unlocking new abilities!

Your hero sheet isn't the only thing you can ready. Every hero also has an attack card and skill cards! Each hero starts the game with two weapon cards, which are sleeved together back-to-back to create a single attack card. Skill cards can also be readied, switching between two complementary abilities.

The app also brings new changes to gameplay, introducing enemies with adaptable strategies, complex status effects, and triggers fully managed by the app, and the ability to develop your heroes based on the choices you make in scenarios. You'll also uncover a wealth of activity between scenarios, such as crafting, shopping in the city, upgrading equipment, and more. Because of these various differences, Descent: Legends of the Dark is not compatible with Descent: Journeys in the Dark and its expansions.

—description from the publisher

[size=14][b]Payment Options:[/b][/size]
[size=12][b]Paypal:[/b][/size] No fee is charged to you, if you pay using Paypal. But Paypal does not change currency at the fair market rate. So you will lose 3% or more of your money, if you are converting to Euros.
[size=12][b]IBAN Bank Transfer:[/b][/size] Payment by bank transfer is possible using an IBAN compatible account. [b]There is a 3% discount if you pay using IBAN Bank Transfer[/b] (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less).
[size=12][b]Wise:[/b][/size] There is a 3% discount if you pay using Wise (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less). The company does currency conversion at the fair market rate, and charges the sender a fee of about 0.5% of the amount of money sent.
[size=12][b]Revolut:[/b][/size] There is a 3% discount if you pay using Revolut (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less). The company does currency conversion at the fair market rate, and there are no fees to send money.
[size=12][b]Interac e-transfer:[/b][/size] If you have a Canadian bank account (like me), then you can pay by Interac e-transfer. In this case, you pay in Canadian dollars, at the fair market exchange rate. There is also a 3% discount, if you pay using Interac e-transfer (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less).
[size=12][b]Local Pickup:[/b][/size] If you live near Siegen, Germany, local pickup is also possible, with a 3% discount for cash payment.
[size=12][b]Payment in Dollars:[/b][/size] It is possible to make Paypal payments in US or Canadian dollars, at the fair market exchange rate. You will automatically receive this option, if your address is in the USA or Canada.
[size=14][b]I take responsibility for the safe delivery of your order:[/b][/size] I am a registered commercial seller. Thus, insofar as you are a private consumer, it is required by German law that I take responsibility for any loss or damage of goods that occurs during shipment.
[size=14][b]Looking for something that is not listed here?[/b][/size] I also sell smaller items on BGG here: https://boardgamegeek.com/geekmarket/user/europa_major?pageid=1
If you want to combine items from my other alias, let me know. The flat rate shipping offered there does not apply to the items listed here. The items sold there will typically (but not always) ship for free with the items sold here.
I can also make [size=12][b]special orders[/b][/size] for items that I don't have in stock. Send me a message concerning an item, and I will check for availability and tell you what the price would be.

Title: Descent: Legends of the Dark Publisher: Fantasy Flight Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Ugly Gryphon Inn
boardgame.description:
A Solo Game by Scott Almes.

You own the only inn within a hundred miles: the questionable prestigious Ugly Gryphon Inn. Your patrons are rowdy and rude, but they are the only ones around. In order to keep the debt collectors at bay, but to do so you must manage some painfully particular, peculiar patrons.

In The Ugly Gryphon Inn, you’ll be tasked with managing your patrons’ various needs to ensure they all get a good night’s rest. Each turn, you’ll send one drowsy patron up to their room, then check to make sure all your patrons are sleeping soundly. If something’s irking them, they might raise a fuss, so keep an eye on what they need as you go. Afterwards, you’ll usher in more guests and keep an eye on the bar to make sure there’s no trouble. There’s never a moment to rest in The Ugly Gryphon Inn!

After you've run out of cards in the deck, then count how many patrons you have in the inn. Do not include patrons in the bar. If you have 7 or more patrons in the inn - you’ve won! If you have less than 7, then you have lost.

boardgame.name: Expedition: South Pacific
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Behind the idyllic, palm-studded shores of remote islands, an ancient evil plots its return. The protégé of one of the Rippers’ most notorious enemies seeks to revive his master’s insidious experiments. The Rippers must track a lost expedition across the vast Pacific to stop him, and perhaps put an end to this evil forever.

Expedition: South Pacific is the next in a series of supplements that take the war with the Cabal to the most incredible and inaccessible places on Earth. Each book contains background information, new gear, hazards, monsters, and a complete Plot Point Campaign.

boardgame.name: Flash Gordon Conversion
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Flash Gordon RPG setting was written for Savage Worlds Deluxe, but it’s easy to update for the Savage Worlds Adventure Edition. Most of the rules can be used as-is. Those that require a little more work are detailed in this free download.

boardgame.name: Madara
boardgame.description:
Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Madara_%28manga%29 Madara (manga)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

The Famicom video game Mōryō Senki MADARA was a Konami 1990 release that was never localized. It was large for its time at 4 megabits, and used the "VRC6" sound enhancement mapper chip that was also used in Akumajō Densetsu, the Japanese version of Castlevania III: Dracula's Curse. It differed from the Final Fantasy and Dragon Quest RPGs of the time in that it had movement around battlefields rather than stationary turn-by-turn movements.

boardgame.name: King Arthur: Knight's Tale
boardgame.description: You are Sir Mordred, the nemesis of King Arthur, the former black knight of the grim tales. You killed King Arthur, but with his dying breath, he struck you down. You both died – and yet, you both live.

boardgame.name: Idle Hands
悪魔でお仕事
boardgame.description:
In the must-follow trick-taking game Idle Hands, a.k.a. 悪魔でお仕事, the led suit is determined by an extra card played to the trick from among a player's face-up mission cards. The highest card of the led suit wins all the cards, then adds the mission card to their hand! Every trick is worth points, but this isn't necessarily a good thing since the 4s and 8s are worth their face value in negative points.

At the end of the game, whoever has the most points — or more frequently the fewest negative points — wins!

boardgame.name: Minions of Disruptions: a collaborative climate game for organizations and communities
boardgame.description:
Fueled by climate change, millions upon millions of minions are set to disrupt the way we live on Planet Earth: Carbions build up Disruption Scale as our reliance on oil, plastics, and the like grew; Climmies descend to organizations and communities everywhere and causes disruptions to our normal way of working and living. Some of the minions are bound for your organization. These wicked creatures are mischievous and unpredictable, The only way to bring the minions under control is to activate Zillians, the resilience superheros who provide the ultimate resilience any organization can wish for a sustainable future.

In Minions of Disruptions, you and your fellow players are colleagues from the same organization or neighbors from the same community to combat climate minions. You must work hard and smart together to activate resilience superheros, Zillians, before the two types of minions, carbions and climmies, take over with their disruptions.

Minions of Disruptions is designed to be played by multiple teams, and can also be played standalone by one single team.

boardgame.name: The Little Flower Shop: Employee Pack
boardgame.description:
Send your employee to the warehouse to grab what you need for your window display! The Employee Pack is a brand new expansion containing 10 "employee" cards and 2 rule cards. At the start of the game, remove 10 random shop cards and replace them with the 10 employee cards. With the 10 removed cards, flip 4 of them to make the "warehouse." At the end of each round, players who kept employee cards during the round can now discard them to take a card from the warehouse (and flip a new one to replace the chosen one). If multiple players have employee cards, they take turns in order on the cards - so watch out that someone else doesn't take the card you were eyeing!

-description from kickstarter

The Forgotten Rites of the Moldering Dead is a supplement containing:

boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: A Collection of Classic Games from the Intellivision
boardgame.description:
(from back of case)
The Finest TV Programming the 1980s Had to Offer.
Now you can relive 30 of your classic Intellivision video game memories from the '80s. From space battles to sports, you'll find dozens of your all-time favorites right here in one jam-packed compilation--perfectly converted for the PlayStation game console. Now that's what we call "quality television programming."

Includes 30 Games
Armor Battle, Astrosmash, Auto Racing, Baseball, Basketball, Boxing, Checkers, Chess, Football, Frog Bog, Golf, Hockey, Hover Force, Vegas Poker & Blackjack, Night Stalker, Pinball, Sea Battle, Shark! boardgame.name: The Book of the Dead: An Undead Bestiary
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Welcome to the Book of the Dead! Inside these cursed pages you’ll find a horde of undead monsters for your D&D games. Necromancers beware, not all of these monsters can be easily controlled.

Included in this book are templates that you can apply to other monsters, turning them into terrifying undead monstrosities. Two formidable vampire NPCs make their 5th edition appearance here, The Black Duke and Red Widow. A tactics section guides you on the best ways to handle each monster.

The dead are stirring, and will not be stopped. Prepare yourself for an onslaught of over 100 undead!

boardgame.name: GLADIATOR: Fight To The Finish
boardgame.description:
Fast-action card game for 2 players, designed to simulate the deadly dance of fighting with sword and shield.

The mechanics seek to solve the problem of realistically capturing the flow of gladiator combat without getting bogged down in lots of charts and dice throws.

Players draw a hand of 9 cards from their own deck and alternate playing attacks, feints, blocks and maneuvers, hoping to catch their opponent with his guard down.

Wounds reduce the size of subsequent hands drawn. The game ends when one player is reduced to zero (killed) – or has stopped the game to plea for his life.

Gladiators may be named and tracked for on-going campaigns or tournament play.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Stirling Edition
boardgame.description:
The world's favourite family board game brings you another exciting Monopoly: Stirling Edition.

Choose your favourite token, tour the beautiful sights of Stirling, including Stirling Castle and The National Wallace Monument, and accumulate fortunes, but watch out for taxes, jail and bankruptcy.

You owe rent or reap the rewards?

Invest in houses and hotels and trade your way to success.

Monopoly, the great property trading board game finds its home in the vibrant Scottish city of Stirling: a city steeped in history yet offering a host of modern day attractions. Journey around the gameboard and explore landmarks including: The Church of the Holy Rude, Dunblane Cathedral and The King's Knot. Don't forget to stop off for some refreshments en route at The Birds and The Bees or Blairmains Farm Shop & Coffee Bothy. You can further relax with a spa date at The Stirling Highland Hotel or take in some art at the Stirling Smith Art Gallery and Museum.

boardgame.name: Bibellinjen
boardgame.description:
Bibellinjen (Bible line) is a simple game which focuses on learning the order of the books of the Bible. It is fast paced, simple to learn and fun for all ages. The game comes with four different variants makes it a suitable match for different age groups and will work well with Sunday schools, youth groups and other Bible oriented contexts.

The first edition is published in Swedish in November 2020. If there is interest it may be translated in to other languages as well.

Bibellinjen is inspired by the game Time line by Frédéric Henry.

Gameplay (standard rules):
Players try to collect points by gaining cards. When it is your turn you deal five cards and place them face up in front of you. You should then try to rearrange the cards so they are placed in the same order that they appear in the Bible. Each card has the name of a Bible book on one side and on the other side there is a number that indicates what order that book has in the Bible. By flipping the cards you can see if the order you settled for is correct or not. If all cards are not in the right order you must remove cards from the sequence until a correct sequence remains. Once that is done you may keep any cards still in front of you. The other cards are discarded to a discard pile which is shuffled into the draw deck when it runs out. The game ends when there are not enough cards in the draw pile to finish the round. The player who collected the most cards is the winner.

—description from the designer

Bibellinjen är ett enkelt spel som går ut på att lära sig ordningen på Bibelns böcker. Det går snabbt att spela, är lätt att lära sig och är roligt för alla åldrar. Med fyra olika varianter för olika åldersgrupper passar det utmärkt till såväl ­konfirmandgrupper som söndagsskolor och andra bibelorienterade sammanhang.

—description from the designer (Swedish)

boardgame.name: Safecracker
boardgame.description:
Safecracker is a simple deduction game played with a standard deck of cards.

To setup, remove all 10s, jacks, queens, and kings from the deck. These cards will not be used. One card in each suit is removed. These cards make up the combination to the safe. The other cards are dealt out to the players. Some may get more than others.

The player with the fewest cards goes first. On a turn, a player asks about a possible combination, i.e. one card from each suit. All other players must announce how many of those cards they have and then show these cards to the active player. At any time, a player may say "stop!" and check to see if they have the right combination.

Optional rules to make the game easier allow calling a specific suit, in which case each player must show you one card of that suit, or, instead, a suit and a player, in which case that player must announce how many cards they have in that suit and then show you all of them.

boardgame.name: Dossier
boardgame.description:
Dossier is a head to head spy game of stealth and deduction
Dossier (daa·see·ei) is a head to head game where you play as a spy trying to collect intel. The first player to collect 3 case of intel or successfully assassinate the enemy spy to win.

There are 16 spy cards laid out face up (in a 4x4 grid), there are 5 intel brief cases spread out between them. Each player is given a card (facedown) that matches one of the 16 cards in front of both players. These are their spies for this game. Each player takes turns moving through the crowd, collecting intel briefcases and trying to deduce who their counterpart's spy is. The first player to either collect 3 briefcases or successfully assassinate their opponent wins.

This is a mint tin game, with simple to teach rules, quick games, where the more you play, the deeper the strategy gets.

On your turn, you can complete 1 of 3 actions.

1. Switch ANY two adjacent spy cards on the grid. Your spy does not have to be either of the two spies that are switched.

2. Pick Up Intel: If your spy is next to an intel briefcase, you can pick it up & place it in front of you. Be aware that now the other player can deduce that you are 1 of the 4 spies next to the Intel Briefcase.

3. Assassinate: If you are confident that you know who the enemy player’s spy is, you can attempt to assassinate them. To do this, you simply announce that you want to attempt to assassinate a spy. Pull the card from the grid you want to assassinate. The enemy player then reveals their facedown Green Falcon Card. If it is a match you win! If it is not a match, your assassination failed and you lose the game. So be sure that you know who they are before assassinating them!

boardgame.name: El Joc de Valencià
boardgame.description:
El Joc de Valencià is a board game in which the city of Valencia, its most emblematic monuments and shops are the protagonists.

El Joc de Valencià is a game for the whole family with rules between Monopoly and The Game of the Goose .

With El Joc de Valencià you can buy monuments such as Micalet, Mercat Central or shops like Alvaro Moliner, Espai Ripalda, Trufas Martínez, Casa Montaña ... or become the master of the city by acquiring the Oceanogràfic or the Bioparc.

A nice way to get to know the city of Valencia.

boardgame.name: One-Dimensional Chess
boardgame.description:
Doc Pop's One-Dimensional Chess is a chess variant that puts a new spin on the classic game of chess. The board consists of 16 squares in one row. Each of the two players have a pawn, a knight, a bishop, a rook, a queen, and a king.

The pieces have modified rules that allow them to move in one-dimension. For instance, knights can jump 2 or 3 tiles from where they started. Bishops travel along every other tile, ignoring any pieces on squares of a different color than the one they currently occupy.

By breaking chess down into one single row, players may find themselves visualizing moves a little further in advance than they could in a normal game of chess.

Doc Pop's One-Dimensional Chess started off as an experiment, but after years of testing and feedback, it's turned into a highly enjoyable strategy game worth checking out.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Ducks in Tow: The Angry Goose Mini-Expansion
boardgame.description:
The angry goose is scaring away the ducks! Even you're afraid to go near him! Help your duck friends to stay away from the angry goose.

The Angry Goose mini expansions adds a new level of strategy for players looking for a deeper level of spatial puzzle solving.

Score 2 bonus points per Goose Icon if there are no ducks to the left AND to the right of the goose. You can also have geese next to each other. Scaring ducks is a group activity after all!

You don't score any bonus points if there is a duck next to the goose or if there is a missing card on either side of the goose!
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Ducks in Tow

boardgame.name: Platypus
Качконіс
boardgame.description:
Acid? Dangerous? Annoying? A car saleswoman! Edible? Quick? Flexible? Captain America — or an ostrich?

In Platypus, players co-operate to gradually eliminate bad words in order to find and identify the "platypus" through their adjective cards. To set up, eight common words or proper names — the "platypus" cards — are placed face up in front of all the players. The guides know the card that the explorers must guess, and to help the explorers, they give clues in the form of adjective cards that best define the platypus for them. Each guide has a hand of four clue cards, and after each new clue, the explorers must eliminate one or two cards that they think don't match what's being defined by the clues. If the explorers eliminate the platypus, then everyone loses; if they succeed four times, however, then the platypus will stand alone and everyone wins.

boardgame.name: Regicida
boardgame.description:
In Regicida (Kingslayer), each player secretly represents a House and tries to position his allies without raising suspicious.

The Objective of the game could be: position your Allies in the center of the board, in the border of the board, forming the largest cluster as possible or have the most allies afar from each other. Only one is chosen during the Setup.

The game is divided in four phases, performed in the following order: Expansion, Intrigue, Coronation, and Assassination. During the Expansion Phase the players place Ally Tiles to create a 6x6 grid. During the Intrigue Phase, the players can swap positions of Ally Tiles to enhance the position of their Allies. In the Coronation Phase the Houses gain points, according to the Objective, and the Ruling House is the House with the most points. Then, in the Assassination Phase, the players votes to eliminate the player who they think owns the Regent House.

The game ends right after the Assassination Phase and the winner is the player that represents the Ruling House, in case the assassination failed; or the player that represents the House with most points among the assassins.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: カメレオンの定義 (Definition of a Chameleon)
boardgame.description:
カメレオンの定義 (Kamereon no teigi) Definition of a Chameleon is a free PnP game from Japan.

It was a dark and stormy night. We had gathered at the pub in South End Station and held a welcome party for Harris, my best friend. Olivia, who up until now was only into drinking her scotch, called out, "Hey everyone, how about playing a card game?".

I wondered whether or not we'd be able to keep up with the ever changing rules of the game -- like a Chameleon.

At the beginning of the game, the way points are scored is undefined. But as the game goes on, you will gradually find out how to score points through the cards you play. Because of this, each game will play out differently.
publisher's summary

Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – TIE/rb Lourd

The TIE/rb Heavy is one of the largest TIE variants produced for the Galactic Empire and is often assigned to patrol routes where it is expected to fight without the support of a carrier or escorts. Thanks to its robust armor, swiveling laser cannons, and integrated MGK-300-series droid intelligence, this vessel lives up to its nickname: the "Brute."

The TIE/rb Heavy Expansion Pack includes everything you need to add one of these imposing ships to your Galactic Empire squadrons, beginning with a beautifully detailed, pre-painted miniature and a medium plastic base. Four ship cards give you the freedom to choose your pilot, while 12 upgrade cards invite you to customize your ship to fir your needs. Finally, two Quick Build cards offer helpful combinations of pilots and upgrades to get you into the fight right away.

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Armada – Galactic Republic Fleet Starter
boardgame.description:
War! The ancient Jedi Order has taken to the stars to defend the Galactic Republic. As the threat of the Separatist Alliance spreads, leaving plundered worlds and petty tyrants in its wake, the Republic fleet is often outnumbered, but never outmatched. Guided by the ideals of the Republic, commanding legions of dedicated Clone Troopers, and equipped with versatile warships and elite starfighters, champions such as Obi-Wan Kenobi and Bail Organa fight to bring a swift end to the chaos of the Clone Wars and restore peace to the galaxy.

Star Wars: Armada – Galactic Republic Fleet Starter lays the foundation for your Galactic Republic fleets by putting you in command of a mighty Acclamator-class Assault ship and two powerful Consular-class Cruiser miniatures. These ships are joined by four squadrons of V-19 Torrent Starfighters flown by crack clone pilots ready to defend the fleet. Additionally, 20 upgrade cards invite you to customize every aspect of your ships with iconic officers and powerful weapons.

No matter how you decide to outfit your fleet, the Galactic Republic Fleet Starter is an excellent place to begin building your Star Wars: Armada collection. You'll find all the components necessary to begin playing within this set, including nine attack dice, ten command dials, eight speed dials, twelve objective cards, six obstacle tokens, a range ruler, and a maneuver tool. Assemble your fleet and destroy the enemy!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Armada – Separatist Alliance Fleet Starter
boardgame.description:
War! Commanded by the sinister Count Dooku, the Separatist Alliance has drawn numerous worlds into open insurrection against the Galactic Republic, spreading chaos and tyranny in the name of greed. With its powerful warships and vast reserves of droid forces, the Separatist fleet seems an insurmountable threat to peace and freedom in the galaxy.

This Fleet Starter provides the building blocks for your own Separatist fleet, starting with a Munificent-class Frigate miniature and two Hardcell-class Transport miniatures. These ships are supplemented by four squadrons of Vulture-class Droid Fighters ready to swarm their enemies. In addition to these miniatures, six ship cards give you the power to choose the exact models that make up your fleet and 20 upgrade cards invite you to fine-tune each ship with iconic officers, powerful weapons, and more.

No matter how you decide to outfit your fleet, the Separatist Alliance Fleet Starter is an excellent place to begin building your Star Wars: Armada collection. You’ll find all the components necessary to begin playing within this set, including nine attack dice, 10 command dials, eight speed dials, 12 objective cards, six obstacle tokens, a range ruler, and a maneuver tool. Assemble your fleet and destroy the enemy!

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Armada – Republic Fighter Squadrons Expansion Pack
boardgame.description:
Devastate your opponent's squadrons with the speed and power of the Galactic Republic's fighter squadrons! Harness the agility of Delta-7 Aethersprites, bombard enemy captial ships with BTL-B Y-wings, control the battlefield with heavy ARC-170 Starfighters, and escort your forces with versatile V-19 Torrents.

All together, this expansion adds eight Republic fighter squadrons to your fleets, including seven elite pilots. Defend the Republic with the Republic Fighter Squadrons Expansion Pack!

boardgame.description:

All told, this expansion adds eight Separatist fighter squadrons to your fleets, including six elite pilots. Take the power of these sinister pilots into your hands with the Separatist Fighter Squadrons Expansion Pack!

boardgame.name: The Village of Death
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

When the PCs stumble across a dockside fire they get more than they bargained for. The big question is, will they survive?



The Short Non-Spoiler Version

While travelling by ship, the watch spots a constant stream of smoke rising from over the horizon. Upon arrival they find an eerie village full of secrets, and danger.

This is the first adventure in The Season of the Sea Witch series which finds the PCs caught in the middle of a struggle between forces more powerful than themselves.


The Spoiler Version

This ship is attracted to a mysterious village because of a raging fire on its dock warehouses. When the Party arrives, they find that the fire is unattended and the village seems deserted. However, it's actually a trap set by the Undead Armada who are recruiting the living to undeath. This is in service to the Sea Witch who is amassing an armada for some unknown purpose. If the superstitious old sailors are to be believed, the Sea Witch is a lich bent on pillage and domination. The Sea Witch tower is said to ride the seas on an island that moves. But old sailors often tell tall tales, hopefully this is one of them.
This is the first adventure in The Season of the Sea Witch series which finds the PCs caught in the middle of a struggle between an undying lich, and the Elemental Lords. Sides have been drawn, alliances made, and now the fight for dominion begins.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Cluster at Kamloops II
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This scenario was created for our second year at Kamloops RPG convention in British Columbia. Like most of our convention offerings, this scenario offers the DM a great amount of flexibility for encounters thrown at PCs. We have included more than enough adventures for you to use as a whole, or disect for entertaining one shots.

This adventure setting was designed for both 5th Edition rules for the Filbar Campaign for six, fourth level adventurers and DM.

boardgame.name: Rivals and Allies: Biaga, The Prima Ghoula
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Come now, come. Biaga wants to see the gift you have brought. Oh, how magnificent! Settle in, darling, it’s going to take a season to finish this feast.”
— Biaga, The Prima Ghoula, as recorded by the sainted spirit wielder, Ideemus Shars

Biaga was once the premier bard of the legendary City of Saints opera house. Known far and wide for her angelic singing voice and equally heavenly beauty, the Prima Donna brought in visitors from all corners of the continent to witness her take the stage. Biaga’s social circles were filled with lords and ladies of the highest regard and even the King and Queen were among those who she could truly call friends and regale with private concerts and charming conversation. But it was this friendship that would lead to the end of Biaga’s enchanted life, and the beginning of her ghastly existence.

This supplement includes:

Information on the bard NPC Biaga, the Prima Ghoula.
Roleplaying tips to help GMs bring her to life.
Biaga's CR 8 Stat Block.
Plot hooks to introduce your party to this NPC.

boardgame.name: Безумная кухня
boardgame.description:
Teams take turns to become of chefs and visitors to the Crazy Kitchen restaurant! A team of visitors places orders, a team of chefs, using original mechanics of this game, try to fulfill as many orders as possible until the time runs out. Completed orders are worth victory points. The team with the most VP wins!

A team of chefs, having received an order from a team of visitors, begins to cook it. To do this, one team member searches for the necessary ingredients in the "boxes" and gives it to a partner. Partner takes a suitable tool, for example, a knife, represented by a pile of cards, places an ingredient card under this pile and discards all the cards from the resulting pile as quickly as possible, flipping them along the way, until he discards and flip the ingredient card - then this ingredient is ready and can be used for cooking. When all the ingredients cards are ready, it will be order ready and will earn the team victory points!

«Kitchen Crazy» is a real-time card game and a team of chefs can cook several orders at the same time. The main thing is to have time until the sand spills out...

boardgame.name: DSbuilders
boardgame.description:
Our Emperor asked for new ways to spread terror through the sectors. He engaged the best scientists in the galaxy to design the definitive weapon to defeat the Rebellion: a massive Orbital Station...the Dark Star.

In DSbuilders, six Koenigs have six cycles to build the station while the galaxy is on fire and a riddle of unpredictable events influences the strategy to follow. If this scenario sounds familiar and you are an agilist, this is your game. The game is based on the assumption that all players have basic knowledge of Agile and Scrum, and a facilitator, like an experienced Agile Coach (or similar), is available.

In fact, DSbuilders is a team-based, co-operative, serious game on scaling agile teams across organization. The game is played by six teams, each of them with 1 to 8 players, and they have to build all systems of the Dark Star, the new weapon designed to conquer the galaxy.

The game takes place over six turns, and each turn the teams have to define their work (components to build) considering all constraints (capacity, integrations and dependencies). At the end of each turn, the Emperor (facilitator) defines the short term goal on the basis of the events happening in the galaxy.

If you fail to achieve any intermediate goal, game over!
If you fail to achieve the final goal, game over!
If you achieve the final goal, you conquer the galaxy!

boardgame.name: El Corazón de la Oscuridad
boardgame.description:
Marvalar, capital de Reino Bosque y principal baluarte de Valion contra las fuerzas del mal, es una ciudad de maravillas, donde la luz de la razón y la justicia brillan con gran fulgor. Pero en sus entrañas, oculta durante siglos por el paso del tiempo y la ignorancia, se halla una antiquísima y gigantesca mazmorra, llena de tesoros, hechizos y criaturas sin parangón. Nuestros personajes se verán involucrados en la exploración de este subterráneo a petición de las autoridades de la ciudad. En su recorrido por sus antiguas salas descubrirán terribles secretos y misterios de otrora, enfrentándose a peligros ignotos y maldiciones milenarias...

La búsqueda de una reina, el hallazgo de un artefacto de gran poder, el descubrimiento de una terrible verdad, el final de una guerra o el comienzo de otra, la exploración de una ciudad subterránea, el enfrentamiento con entidades conformadas de pura maldad y la posibilidad de convertirse en los más rutilantes héroes de todo Valion... o en sus peores villanos.

Todo esto y mucho más nos espera en esta épica aventura.
boardgame.rpg: Aventuras en la Marca del Este
boardgame.rpgpublisher: Grupo Creativo La Marca del Este

boardgame.name: El Corazón de la Oscuridad - Cartapacio de Mapas
boardgame.description: Para que todos los mecenas del nivel apropiado puedan recibir y mantener los mapas del megadungeon ordenados y a buen recaudo, hemos diseñado esta carpeta, que será remitida junto a los mapas a todos los mecenas (nivel Aventurero) de la campaña.
boardgame.rpg: Aventuras en la Marca del Este
boardgame.rpgpublisher: Grupo Creativo La Marca del Este

boardgame.name: Bestiario de Criaturas Extraordinarias
boardgame.description: En este pequeño pero útil tomo recogemos un buen puñado de criaturas, bestias inmundas las más, amén de otros monstruos variados, algunos de ellos clásicos donde los haya, que servirán para complementar y detallar vuestras campañas de juego en el salvaje y misterioso mundo de La Marca del Este
boardgame.rpg: Aventuras en la Marca del Este
boardgame.rpgpublisher: Grupo Creativo La Marca del Este

boardgame.name: Xixit
boardgame.description:
Xixit is an addictive, challenging puzzle game that tests your nerves to the breaking point. You must organize falling columns of tiles in an effort to get 3 of the same tile in a row. They can be horizontal, vertical, or diagonal (or any combination of the three). To add variety, over 10 different tile sets are included, many of which are animated.

Compete for points or go head-to-head with a friend via any one of the 2-player modes (Null-modem/Modem/Network/Keyboard Sharing). In 2-player mode, you are able to affect your opponents game by scoring chain reactions.

Xixit contains a 6-song soundtrack by some of the hottest game musicians in the world, including CC Catch, Nemesis, Necros, and Mesonyx. To add to the challenge, distracting backgrounds are included which get more and more distracting with each level achieved.

The CD-ROM version also features 10 professionally-recorded tracks by Area 51 Records. These songs can be played without the game by using the CD-ROM in any CD player. That's over one hour of CD-quality stereo music!

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Las Frondas de los Medianos
boardgame.description: Las Frondas de los Medianos es un paraje bucólico, de belleza natural sublime, conformado por suaves colinas herbosas cubiertas de cúmulos de flores salvajes con vivos y alegres colores. Hacia el Oeste, las floridas lomas alcanzan la ribera del Oxus y desde lo alto de las quebradas se puede observar, a lo lejos, la sombra oscura de la ciénaga y la gran mancha esmeralda de las Praderas de los Centauros.
boardgame.rpg: Aventuras en la Marca del Este
boardgame.rpgpublisher: Grupo Creativo La Marca del Este

boardgame.name: Marjalnegro
boardgame.description: Enclavado allende los océanos, más allá del Mar de Poniente, perdido en los albores del tiempo tras la caída del legendario continente de Zafiria, persiste un mundo nuevo, rebosante de aventuras y rincones por explorar, ahíto de monstruos de antaño, reliquias y ruinas de otrora. Marjalnegro aguarda paciente la llegada de nuevos aventureros que hollen sus caminos y descubran sus misterios
boardgame.rpg: Aventuras en la Marca del Este
boardgame.rpgpublisher: Grupo Creativo La Marca del Este

boardgame.name: Agile SyS
boardgame.description:
As new Agile coach you are assigned to 5 squads that are in the middle of their journey to adopt agile.
You have to gain their Trust and increase their Motivation by investing your Time and your Portfolio of skills and tools to create a culture of Collaboration, Autonomy, Mastery and Purpose.

You have 6 months (12 sprints) to make this happen, while squads are facing Antipatterns and eventually Disruptions.

If the above scenario sounds familiar, this is your game. In fact Agile SyS, Support your Squads) is a solo serious game to simulate the difficulties in the journey to agility for a small team of teams and provide a list of possible solutions that could help the coach (here called “The Agent”, aka “agent of change”) to gain the trust of teams (here called “Squads”) he is working with.

Main goal of the Agent is to achieve highest level of trusts with squads while improving skills and tools that help also to face common wrong behaviours happening in squads. Time is the “money” of the game: player is often in the position not to have enough time to gain skills and tools, time to spend in actions, or time to achieve results, because the game ends in 12 rounds.

Agile Sys, has been designed in lockdown time for one player, however you can merge 2 or more decks and play the game with other Agents. This configuration is ideal to understand scaling in large organisation where different coaches are working together in the same program or business function.

boardgame.name: Wild Cats: Bonus Cats
boardgame.description:
More cats = more fun! The Fat Cat is the boss who steals all of the credit. The Cool Cat is too cool to play along. And the Smarty Cat knows more than anyone else!

A set of 3 extra roles for Wild Cats, to diversify and play up to 6 players: Fat Cat, Cool Cat and Smarty Cat.


This expansion is included in the Deluxe editions of the base game.


RULES

Fat Cat
You MAY tell the truth or lie.
Reveal yourself before the vote.
You don't vote, but you still point. You steal the win if you point to the winning player.

Cool Cat
You MAY tell the truth or lie.
You can't ask questions.
You do not vote. You win if no other player wins.

Smarty Cat
You MAY tell the truth or lie. At any time, reveal yourself, choose a player and look at their card.
You do not vote. You tie for a win if the player you chose loses.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Wild Cats

boardgame.name: Crimibox: Dossier As
boardgame.description:
Solve your own murder mystery. With the help of a chat bot you investigate police files, photo's and evidence. Search the internet and use social media to unravel the secrets of your suspects.

When Antje van den Hoef suddenly died she left her loved ones and the police with a lot of unanswered questions. Why did she request to be cremated? Why did she already have an urn? And why was the urn already filled before her cremation?

There is no body. Only ashes. Hunt for the coldblooded murderer on the unlikely hunting grounds of the retirement home. A leopard never changes its spots. And despite all the false teeth, this monster still has all of them.

Some of the features included in this game:

Analyse documents
Decipher secret codes
Watch video footage
Scour social media for clues


And much more!

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: シネマトペ (Cinematopoeia)
boardgame.description:
シネマトペ (Cinematopoeia) is a communication, party game from Japan, where players make sounds to match scenes in a movie. The game is in English and Japanese.

You are in the movie theatre, but the sound effects have disappeared. So you must make the sounds yourself! Did the vase break? Did you get in the time machine? What kind of sound do you hear then?

It's a game where you freely say the sounds you imagine and match up ideas! The game is in Japanese and English, with illustrations, so playing with foreigners is easy. Discover fun new expressions!

There is no wrong answer for sound effects. Feel free to express your own sounds and have fun!

There are themes for actions, like 'broken vase' and themes like 'falling in love' or 'riding in a time machine'. It is a fun game to show your individuality. Hitting the right card for other people's sounds is exciting too.

The game has 30 cards with themes written in Japanese and English, and 30 cards with illustrations of movie scenes. A player makes the missing sound effect from the theme, and the others try to pick the matching scene card as fast as they can. The game is very simple to learn and play. Children can play as easily as adults, so it is a good family game.

花瓶が割れた？タイムマシンに乗った？その時、聞こえる音ってどんな音？
イメージする音を自由に言って、みんなで当て合うゲームです！
英語にも対応しています。外国の方と遊んでも表現が変わって楽しい！

ここは効果音が消えた映画館。

なぜなら、音をつけるのはアナタだから！

お題カードの場面の音を想像して、自分で好きな音をつけましよう！

他のプレイヤーはイラストカードからどの場面か探してタッチしましょう。

カルタ形式のゲームなので、ルール簡単ですぐに遊べます。

お題カード、イラストカードは30種類あります。

子供から大人まで楽しめるゲームなので、ご家族にもおすすめです。

効果音に正解はありません。自分の音を自由に表現して楽しんでください！

「花瓶が割れた」などの擬音語や、「恋に落ちた」「タイムマシンに乗った」などの擬態語のお題もあり個性がでるのが楽しいゲームです。

他の人の音を当てるのも、わいわい盛り上がりますよ。

簡単なルールですぐに遊べる、コミュニケーションゲームです。
publisher's summary

boardgame.name: When Comes the Moon (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Moonlight and Madness!

The famed observatory at Asteria Point has long endured upon its mountain heights, yet wars, plagues, and the ravages of time have dimmed its glory to a faint ember kept by a tiny order of faithful monks. When sinister forces stalk the night and even those faithful few begin to disappear, the church sends out a call for heroes to investigate and save this remnant of a wiser and more learned age. Yet all is not as it seems among the high peaks, and secrets grow darker and danger ever deeper with the moon’s every rising.

When Comes the Moon is a 5E adventure for 8th-level characters set in Yolbiac Vale, in the Lost Lands Campaign Setting. This rich and exciting world 20 years in the making has been home to dozens of adventures from Necromancer Games and Frog God Games and produced with their cooperation to be compatible with The World of the Lost Lands campaign guide! It is the second of six adventures in the Aegis of Empires Adventure Path, with each adventure exploring hitherto unexplored areas of the Lost Lands with a combination of horror, intrigue, deadly danger, and the lure of ancient mysteries.

boardgame.name: Hatamoto: Rivals
boardgame.description:
In Hatamoto: Rivals, you play as one of legendary samurai Takeda Shingen's renowned 24 generals. From the 12 generals available to choose, each with his own unique ability, you must manage your province well enough to provide Shingen with the troops and supplies he demands for his war effort.

You can recruit Infantry and Cavalry, build more Rifles, and grow more Rice, but will it be enough for his next order? Pay your rival Hatamoto a small favor to make him more pliable, and then request help to fill Shingen's order for you this turn. But helping you gets him half your Honor reward...

Players must balance their own province's production with currying favor with their rival Hatamoto to fill as many of Shingen's requests as possible. Whichever Hatamoto ends the game with the most Honor will be named Shingen's next Taisho.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Confrontation
boardgame.description:
Confrontation is played with the 4-10 from two standard decks of cards. 13 cards are dealt to each player and the remaining 4 are discarded unseen. The players sit with partners across from each other.

On a turn a player plays a card to their team's area, either creating a new set or adding to an existing set. Sets can either be cards of the same number of cards of the same suit. If a set is ambiguous (e.g. any single card) it does not have to be declared. Once a set is unambiguous it is moved to the imaginary "confrontation line" between the two team's areas. A team may not have more than one of each kind of set.

Once all cards have been played any ambiguous sets are discarded and the rest are compared; the team with more cards in a set of given type gets the points for that type. Number sets are worth their printed value and suit sets are worth ten.

boardgame.name: Dead in the Water
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

ADVENTURE ONE of THREE Classic Stand-alone Call of Cthulhu Explorations
from the Kingsport: The City in the Mists supplement

In which the Investigators get their sea-legs - and discover that dreams aren't the only things lurking in Kingsport's mist.

This adventure is intended for groups of three or more investigators of no small experience. Less seasoned parties will be sorely pressed to successfully handle the opposition. Dead in the Water will probably take at least two evenings to play.

This scenario does not require the investigators to reside or be visiting Kingsport, only that they are near enough to read or hear of the disappearances plaguing the town and its residents.

The Kingsport setting book describing the coastal Massachusetts town of Kingsport, the City in the Mists - "draped in mists and fog, it is home to artists and fishermen, sailors and dreamers. Here dreams and reality mingle to an unsettling degree."

Dead in the Water is the first converted tale for use with Fantasy Grounds II out of this collection. The remaining tales will be sold separately as they are converted. Each tale is a standalone adventure that can be run with no connection to any of the other adventures in the Kingsport book.

Fantasy Grounds Conversion by: Brian Benbrook

boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

PART ONE of Six Classic Stand-alone Explorations
of the Unknown, the Deserted, and the Insane from MANSIONS OF MADNESS collection.

In dim, forgotten recesses of the world lurk mind-twisting horrors. Through the use of human agents these horrors work to thwart mankind’s destiny.

However, not all of these human agents are willing partners. Many times have the monsters resorted to subtlety and intrigue to further their ends, rather than gross displays of sheer destruction.

Andrew Keetling is one such unwilling agent. A successful Boston businessman, he has disappeared — held captive in a mansion of madness.

boardgame.name: Match Attax: UEFA Champions League – Season 2019/20
boardgame.description:
This is a 2019/2020 UEFA Champions League Match Attax card game, sealed display box contains 50 packs of 6 cards, for a total of 300 cards !
Become part of the biggest football competition in the world with this sensational card game from Topps, official 2019-20 UEFA Champions League. This product is loaded with the best stars of the UEFA Champions League.
Try cards from global superstars and childhood heroes like Ronaldo, Lionel Messi, Christian Pulisic, Neymar, Harry Kane, Robert Lewandowski, and many others.

boardgame.name: Blackwater Creek
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

First of two adventures included in the Keeper ScreenKeeper’s Screen[/rpgitem] for Call of Cthulhu 7th Edition.

In Blackwater Creek, three or more investigators travel to the rural town of Cade’s Rest to investigate the disappearance of an archaeological professor from Miskatonic University, only to discover that something sinister is taking over both the town and the wilderness.

In Blackwater Creek, two alternate introductions are provided to entice investigators into the town; that of associates of the university, and as criminal bootleggers. The module is suitable for new or seasoned investigators, but is weighted towards new groups.

Converted by: Brian Hill

boardgame.name: Missed Dues
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Second of two adventures included in the Keeper’s Screen for Call of Cthulhu 7th Edition.

In Blackwater Creek, the investigators have been summoned to the office of Mordecai "The Hammer" O'Leary on South French Hill Street. They are tasked with finding "Sticky Jack", a thief that has crossed Leary by pulling three recent robberies without paying his cut. Jack was last seen after he made his thefts at the Miskatonic University. The players must find Jack or face the wrath of Mordecai and his claw hammer.

This is a short investigation suitable for new or seasoned investigators, but is weighted towards new groups. It includes six pre-generated characters and portraits.

Converted by: Ian Ward

boardgame.name: Cash Flow
boardgame.description:
Cash Flow uses a standard 52-card deck and a supply of money (points). Each player receives 30 points. The deck is shuffled and one card is turned up to start a row.

On a turn a player can choose to buy any number of cards from the row, including none. The card farthest from the deck costs ten, the next nine, and so on, with a minimum cost of one. Regardless of whether or not any cards were purchased a new card is drawn and placed at the end of the row.

The cards are used to form sets of the same suit or same rank. However, a suit set can only contain cards from 2-9 or J-A - the high and low cards cannot be mixed. A table of set values is provided. Before buying cards a player may sell any number of sets from their hand.

The game continues until the deck runs out and no players want to sell any sets or buy any cards.

boardgame.name: Bloodline: k'Heuraeth
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Banshees haunt Kindred and kine. They feast on the restless dead. They draw the living into the grave and watch them suffocate from fear.

A new type of vampire hides just beyond the Shroud, ready to drag their victims straight into Oblivion.

Sensitive Content Warning: Instances of child abuse and suicide.

boardgame.name: Soldatenspiel
boardgame.description:
The blue army (50 infantry and 12 cavalry) are positioned on 62 spaces near the mill, while the red army occupies 62 spaces near the farm on the other side of the river.

Movement in any direction is 6 spaces for the infantry or 10 spaces for the cavalry per turn. The player has to decide if he moves his infantry or cavalry.

The players try to take enemy pieces by enclose them so that they can't move. Enclosed troops are removed from the game.

The first player to take 10 enemy pieces wins the game

The 1933 edition of the game includes two expansions for advanced players: "Zeppelin and airplanes" and "Trenches".

—user summary
